New Records: Greece extended their perfect Nations League campaign with a 2-0 win over Ireland.
Anastasios Bakasetas scored the first goal in the 48th minute.
Petros Mantalas scored the second goal in the 90th minute.
Greece maintained 55.2% possession compared to Ireland's 44.8%.
Odisseas Vlachodimos made a key save for Greece.
Key Match Events: Anastasios Bakasetas scored the opening goal in the 48th minute.
Petros Mantalas sealed the win with a goal in the 90th minute.
Republic of Ireland's Dara O'Shea received a red card in the 82nd minute.
Mikey Johnston had a late attempt on goal in extra time.
Pre-Game Insights: Greece was on a four-game win streak before the match.
The match was held at Georgios Karaiskakis Stadium in Piraeus, Greece.
Post-Match Reflections: Greece's players and fans celebrated the victory.
Republic of Ireland expressed frustration over the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was attended by 30,253 fans.
Key substitutions were made by both teams during the game.
